SENT.plain: A woman aged 31 years presented to the emergency department after a minor head injury
She reported mild headache and a metallic taste in her mouth
Full neurologic examination was remarkable only for left-sided Horner syndrome
Left internal carotid artery dissection was confirmed on magnetic resonance imaging
Symptoms and signs persisted 3 months later, but there was no additional neurologic deficit
We stress the importance of early detection of Horner syndrome to minimize the risk of disabling stroke
